sen.j: 観月橋駅（かんげつきょうえき）は、京都府京都市伏見区豊後橋町にある京阪電気鉄道京阪宇治線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Bungobashi-cho, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, Kangetsukyo Station is a stop of the Keihan Uji Line, which is operated by Keihan Electric Railway.
Kangetsukyo Station, located in Bungobashi-cho, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop of the Keihan Uji Line, which is operated by the Keihan Electric Railway.
Kangetsukyo Station, located in Bungobashi-cho, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop of the Keihan Uji Line, which is operated by the Keihan Electric Railway.

sen.j: 駅は、国道24号が宇治川を跨ぐ観月橋のすぐ西側に所在する。
sen.e: This station is located in the immediate west of Kangetsu-kyo Bridge where National Highway 24 crosses over the Uji-gawa River.
This station is located immediately west of Kangetsu-kyo Bridge, where National Highway 24 crosses over the Uji-gawa River.
This station is located immediately west of Kangetsu-kyo Bridge, where National Route 24 crosses over the Uji-gawa River.
sen.cmt: 国道→National Route としました。

sen.j: 駅構造
sen.e: Station layout
The station's structure
Station layout

sen.j: 相対式2面2線のプラットホームを持つ地上駅である。
sen.e: It is placed on the ground level, with two separate platforms with two tracks served between them
It is placed on the ground level, with two separate platforms with two tracks served between them.
It is placed on the ground level, with two separate platforms with two tracks served between them.

sen.j: 中書島方の国道24号線観月橋北詰（ホーム中書島寄り）に改札口がある。
sen.e: The entrance/exit gates are placed at the north end of Kangetsu-kyo Bridge on National Highway 24, on the Chushojima side, (on the Chushojima side of the platforms).
The entrance/exit gates are placed at the north end of Kangetsu-kyo Bridge on National Highway 24, on the Chushojima side (the Chushojima side of the platforms).
The ticket gates are placed at the north end of Kangetsu-kyo Bridge on National Route 24, on the Chushojima side (the Chushojima side of the platforms).
sen.cmt: 国道→National Route としました。

sen.j: 改札口は上下線別で、改札内で互いのホームを行き来することはできない。
sen.e: A separate entrance/exit gate is provided for each of the up-trains and won-trains, and you cannot move between the platforms inside the gates.
A separate entrance/exit gate is provided for each of the up-trains and down-trains, but one can't move between the platforms inside the gates.
A separate ticket gate is provided for each of the inbound trains and outbound trains, therefore one can't move between the platforms inside the gates.
sen.cmt: 改札口→ticket gate としました。上り、下り→inbound, outbound としました。

sen.j: 宇治方面の改札口に駅員が常駐している。
sen.e: A station officer is always stationed at the gate for the direction of Uji
A station officer is always on duty at the gate for the direction of Uji.
A station officer is always on duty at the gate for the direction of Uji.

sen.j: また朝だけだが観月橋駅の中書島方にある踏切では係員が安全を確認している。
sen.e: In the morning alone, station officers check the safety of the railway crossing placed on the Chushojima side of Kangetsu-kyo Bridge.
In the morning, station officers check the safety of the railway crossing on the Chushojima side of Kangetsu-kyo Bridge.
In the morning, station officers check the safety of the railway crossing on the Chushojima side of Kangetsukyo Station.

sen.j: ※両ホームとも有効長は5両。
sen.e: * The effective lengths of the platforms are those for five-car trains.
* The platforms have lengths sufficient to accommodate five-car trains.
The platforms have lengths sufficient to accommodate five-car trains.

sen.j: 番線表示はない。
sen.e: No track number is displayed.
No track number is displayed.
No Platform number is displayed.

sen.j: 駅周辺
sen.e: Station surroundings
The station's surroundings
Station surroundings

sen.j: 伏見公園
sen.e: Fusimi Park
Fusimi Park
Fusimi Park

sen.j: 国道24号
sen.e: National Highway 24
National Highway 24
National Route 24
sen.cmt: 国道→National Route としました。

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1913年（大正2年）6月1日 京阪宇治線開通と同時に開業。
sen.e: June 1, 1913: The operation of this station started when Keihan Uji Line started its operation.
June 1, 1913: This station became operational simultaneously with the Keihan Uji Line.
June 1, 1913: This station became operational simultaneously with the Keihan Uji Line.

sen.j: 1943年（昭和18年）10月1日 会社合併により京阪神急行電鉄（阪急電鉄）の駅となる。
sen.e: October 1, 1943: Due to the merging of companies concerned, it became a station of Keihanshin Express Railway (present Hankyu Railway).
October 1, 1943: Due to the merger of the companies concerned, it became a station of Keihanshin Express Railway (presently Hankyu Railway).
October 1, 1943: Due to the merger of the companies concerned, it became a station of Keihanshin Express Railway (presently Hankyu Railway).

sen.j: 1945年（昭和20年）9月15日 輸送混乱防止のため、使用を中止。
sen.e: September 15, 1945: Use of this station was stopped for preventing transportation from being disruptted.
September 15, 1945: The use of this station was stopped in order to prevent the disruption of transportation.
September 15, 1945: The use of this station was stopped in order to prevent the disruption of transportation.

sen.j: 1945年（昭和20年）11月8日 営業再開。
sen.e: November 15, 1945: The operation of this station restarted.
November 15, 1945: The operation of this station restarted.
November 8, 1945: The operation of this station restarted.

sen.j: 1949年（昭和24年）12月1日 会社分離により京阪電気鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: December 1, 1949: Corresponding to the division of the company, it became a station of Keihan Electric Railway.
December 1, 1949: Corresponding to the division of the company, it became a station of the Keihan Electric Railway.
December 1, 1949: Corresponding to the division of the company, it became a station of the Keihan Electric Railway.

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）1月9日 宇治行きホームに車イス対応のスロープを設置。
sen.e: January 9, 1987: Slopes for wheelchairs were installed on the platform for Uji.
January 9, 1987: Ramps for wheelchairs were installed on the platform for Uji.
January 9, 1987: Ramps for wheelchairs were installed on the platform for Uji.

sen.j: 観月橋をわたった観月橋南詰めの方には住宅地があり、また近くには駅があまりないためか利用客は多い。
sen.e: Perphaps because many houses exist on the south side of Kangetsu-kyo Bridge, where is reached by crossing the bridge, and any other station is scarecely available in the area, many users utilize this station.
Perphaps because many houses exist on the south side, across Kangetsu-kyo Bridge, and scarcely any other station is available in the area, many people employ this station.
Presumably, because many houses exist on the south side, across Kangetsu-kyo Bridge, and scarcely any other station is available in the area, many people employ this station.
